alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Southampton; Suffolk; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 5:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Northampton, Gates, Hertford, Isle of Wight, Southampton, southeastern York, east central Sussex, southern James City and Surry Counties, the City of Poquoson, the western City of Norfolk, the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Hampton, the City of Newport News, the City of Franklin, the City of Portsmouth and the City of Suffolk through 615 PM EDT... At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Surry to near Sedley to 7 miles southeast of Seaboard. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Courtland, Surry, Sedley and Elberon around 535 PM EDT. Scotland and Hunterdale around 540 PM EDT. Ivor and Jamestown around 545 PM EDT. Woodland and Kings Point around 550 PM EDT. Zuni, Busch Gardens and Carrsville around 555 PM EDT. Holland and Grove around 600 PM EDT. Murfreesboro, Windsor, Chowan University, Fort Eustis and Lee Hall around 605 PM EDT. Newport News and Denbigh around 610 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Vicksville, Milwaukee, Tunis, Pons, Carrollton, Lackey, Longview, Savage, Chowan Beach and Oriana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Southampton; Suffolk; Surry; Sussex; York
